result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jordan R. Hiley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid to victim in the second half of probation sentence
Must be actively involved in treatment/counseling every week

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia; any and all medications shall be taken only as prescribed;  Shall tell any physcian before he obtains any prescription that he is an opiate addict
Shall comply with all rules of the TAD program; Shall submit a DNA sample; shall write a letter of apology to his sone to be given to his TAD counselor on 9/17/15 to be sealed and kept by counselor

Amended from Cash to PA Bond for TAD DPA; all other conditions remain as previously set

Defendant Jordan R. Hiley in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held - bond not addressed at the original P&S in regards to TAD DPA. Discussion held regarding victim rights compliance. Court finds victim rights compliance. Hearing at 09-30-2015 10:45 am
bond returned - defendant was sentenced
Probation Intake Order
TAD DPA
TAD DPA

Defendant Jordan R. Hiley in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Representative from TAD Program in Court.  Stipulation that $1,600 due and owing to victim for restitution.  Court finds victim rights compliant.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  Guilty plea entered in count 1;  guilty plea entered in count 2 & guilty plea entered in count 3.  Court accepts plea's and finds def guilty on all counts.  Statement made by victim.  Court heard from State, Defense and Defendant and sentenced him as follows:  

Count 1:
DPA/TAD program

Count 2 & 3:
W/H sentence - 2 yrs probation
comply w/all rules of the TAD program
no use/possession of controlled substance w/o valid prescription
take medications only as prescribed
no alcohol - avoid any establishment whose primary business involves alcohol
counseling/treatment
court costs
$1,600 restitution to be paid in the second half of his probation
No controlled substances without vald presciption.  He must inform any doctor of his opiate addiction issues
He must be actively involved in treatment/counseling every week.  
Defendant may be released from jail after 8:009 AM on 9-17-15 and must immediately report to his TAD Counselor's office.  
Defendant must write a letter of apology to his son, to be given to his TAD Counselor on 9-17-15 to be sealed and kept by counselor. 

ADA Tienstra to amend terms of DPA to reflect that change.

Defendant Jordan R. Hiley in custody via video w/o counsel.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. was on jail list yesterday, initial done and bond set; This is hearing to find PC; Court reviews DNA rule and finds PC

Defend  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.ant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant Jordan R. Hiley in court, in custody via video from DCJ with attorney Greg E. Vollan (eligible).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $3000 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
